# Copilot Instructions for TeilorenWebSite

## Project Overview
Personal qualification website for a science teacher, hosted at **teiloren.net**. Designed to showcase educational credentials to parents via QR code distribution at schools and through leaflets.

## Target Audience & Access Pattern
- **Primary Users**: Parents researching science tutoring for their children
- **Access Method**: QR codes on leaflets distributed at schools and mailboxes
- **Device Priority**: Mobile and tablet optimization essential
- **Single Page**: All content must fit on one cohesive page

## Core Content Sections
- PhD in Genetics and Evolutionary Biology
- 20 years bioinformatics analysis experience
- University-level teaching (mathematics, informatics, statistics)
- International conference participation
- 4 years Southeast Asia experience
- Bilingual instruction capability (English/French)

## Technical Requirements

### Multilingual Support
- **Languages**: English, French, Vietnamese translations
- Implement language switcher for seamless user experience
- Consider URL structure: `/`, `/fr`, `/vi` or query parameters

### Design Principles
- **Style**: Clean, simple, professional CSS
- **Aesthetic**: Sober and trustworthy presentation
- **Responsive**: Mobile-first approach, tablet-optimized
- **Loading**: Fast load times for QR code traffic
- **Typography**: Clear, readable fonts for credentials

### File Organization
- Keep structure simple for single-page site
- Organize assets: `/images/`, `/docs/` for CV/diplomas
- Separate CSS for maintainability
- Consider `/translations/` or inline JSON for text content

## Development Guidelines
- Prioritize accessibility and readability
- Optimize images for web (compress photos/documents)
- Test across mobile devices and screen sizes
- Ensure professional presentation suitable for parent audience
- Plan for easy content updates (CV, new qualifications)

## Notes for AI Agents
- Focus on professional, trustworthy presentation over flashy design
- Consider parent perspective when suggesting UX improvements
- Prioritize mobile experience - many users will access via phone QR scanning
- Maintain academic credibility in content presentation
